thread.title: Market Wrap: Toorak Village shop sells weeks ahead of its scheduled auction
thread.title_full: Market Wrap: Toorak Village shop sells weeks ahead of its scheduled auction

author: canberratimes.com.au
title: Market Wrap: Toorak Village shop sells weeks ahead of its scheduled auction
text:
This Toorak Village shop at 525 Toorak Road sold for $1,251,000. Photo: Supplied
SALES
Toorak
A Toorak Village shop has sold weeks ahead of its scheduled auction. Fitzroys' Chris Kombi and Mark Talbot sold the 74-square-metre shop at 525 Toorak Road for $1,251,000. Leased to Toorak Travel on a 5x5x5-year lease, it returns $55,000 per annum plus outgoings and GST. The sale price reflected a 4.39 per cent yield.
More than 100 people watched the auction for this Cremorne Street property. Photo: Supplied
Bulleen
Advertisement Developers have snapped up a property at 22 Manningham Road for $3 million despite it being leased until 2020, Stephen Gorman from Gorman Commercial said. The purchased the site on a staggering yield of 3.8 per cent, he said. "This was bought by a local developer and really shows that not all property is being purchased by overseas investors."
Windsor
An owner-occupier has paid $1.5 million for a self-service laundromat in popular High Street. Five bidders vied for the prime freehold property at number 70 at auction after a marketing campaign received more than 60 inquiries, said Teska Carson's Michael Taylor , Tom Maule , and Michael Ludski . The solid brick, single-level building was sold with a lease to Ewash Australia Pty Ltd at a rental of $4387 per calendar month, expiring November 30.
Clayton
A merchandising and distribution business is believed to have paid around $5 million for a substantial office and warehouse at 1808 Princes Highway. The 12,250-square-metre site, a building with room for expansion and prominent location were key factors for the buyer, Savills Australia's Daniel Kelly said.
Cremorne
Gross Waddell's Jonathon McCormack and Andrew Waddell , in conjunction with Teska Carson , have sold a corner warehouse at 9-11 Cremorne Street for $3.3 million. "We had over 100 people at the auction, four or five bidders, and the property was on the market at $2.6 million," Mr McCormack said. It was fought out by two bidders in the finals stages with a local developer triumphing.
Derrimut
Owner occupiers have been active buyers of industrial property in Derrimut. Non-for-profit group, Mambourin Enterprises paid $2.8 million for an office warehouse at 159 East Derrimut Crescent while another occupier/developer purchased a 10,930 square metre site in Castro Way for $1.15 million equating to a sales rate of $105 per square metre, said Knight Frank's Joel Davey .
Altona
CVA Property Consultants sold a large industrial land allotment at 41 Aylesbury Drive for $2.1 million at a per square metre rate of $194.44. Construction ground works are completed and the property currently has permits for both vocational training and heavy vehicle testing and is VIC Roads approved, said Leo Mancino .
Coburg
A childcare investment trust has paid $4.35 million for a former Hungry Jack's outlet at 311-321 Sydney Road with plans to turn it into childcare centre in an off-market deal by Teska Carson's Michael Taylor . The property sold with vacant possession and included a permit for a nine-level building. Two short-term ground floor leases provide a current annual income of $131,000. A further, first floor tenancy was vacant.
Burwood
Residential building specialist Constructing Spaces has snapped up a 413-square-metre warehouse at 8 Tudor Street in a tightly held industrial pocket for $1.13 million. The group will use the premises as its new headquarters, said CBRE's Bryce Pane .
South Yarra
A two-storey shop and office offered to the market for the first time in 40 years was sold by Beller Commercial's Liam Rafferty for $3.3 million on a 2.7 per cent yield. Spirited bidding pushed the price $800,000 above the vendor's reserve, he said.
LEASES
Hawthorn East
EBM Insurance will join Cabrini Health in the former Shell building at 8 Redfern Road. The group took 1550 square metres on a seven-year term. It follows Cabrini leasing the top floor earlier this year. The deal was brokered by Gorman Commercial's Richard Height and CBRE's Gianni Macdonald . "There continues to be a healthy level of leasing enquiry in the inner east particularly for fitted space," Mr Height said. Rent was undisclosed but sources suggest it was in the mid-$300 per sqm.
Dandenong South
Elite Surface Technologies is moving to 305 Frankston /Dandenong Road. The firm took a 3327-square-metre office and warehouse. Savills Australia's Daniel Kelly , who brokered the deal with Chris Telley , said the property was let on a four-year term at $250,000 per annum net. The tenant had outgrown its existing facility and required a new fit-out of its laboratory department, he said.
South Yarra
An Indian restaurant has taken space at 209 Commercial Road on commencing rent of $55,000 net for 3+3 years. The tenant plans to totally refurbish the 135-square-metre premises, said Prowse Burns Commercial's Philip Prowse .
Burwood
A distributor of mechanised medical dispenser units, Willach Pharmacy Solutions, has taken a lease on an office and warehouse at Unit 11, 15-21 Huntingdale Road on an undisclosed rental. Savills Australia's Daniel Kelly said the property was let on a four-year term.
Sunshine West
Crawford Engineering has moved from 41 Robbs Road in West Footscray to new premises at 569 Somerville Road in Sunshine West. The group took 437 square metres at $73.23 per sqm on a three-year lease with a three-year option, said Colliers International's Ashley McIntyre and Stephen Ryan .
MOVERS
Knight Frank has ramped up its residential presence in Australia with the acquisition of Melbourne-based LOOK Property Group led by managing director Michael Robinson , who will bring a team of project marketing and sales consultants. Mr Robinson joins Knight Frank as head of residential project marketing for Australia.
Fitzroys has appointed Mark Talbot and James Gregson to new positions as associate directors. Both have been with the firm for more than a decade. Another agent Michael Ryan has been made a senior associate. Meanwhile, Savills Australia has promoted Chris Pulvirenti to director and Joshua Johnston to associate director of valuations and consultancy.
Submissions to sjohanson@fairfaxmedia.com.au
